professional_experience.company: Big Vision LLC (Provides consulting services in AI, especially Computer Vision & Deep Learning)
professional_experience.title: Machine Learning Intern
professional_experience.how I got the job: On-campus placement. In the first round, we were given a Computer Vision project to do. Second round was a technical interview based on the project and my resume. Finally, a talk with the company Vice-President.
projects: Designed and deployed a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot for an industrial IoT client, enabling natural-language search over product manuals and technical documentation.
Optimized an image similarity search pipeline on AWS ECS by replacing brute-force nearest-neighbor search with FAISS IVF-PQ, cutting system costs by 60% while maintaining retrieval quality.
Improved a U2Net-based Code 39 barcode decoder by fine-tuning with synthetic data and enhancing edge-detection algorithms, increasing robustness under low-contrast and distorted imaging conditions.
Elevated solar panel detection accuracy to 95% by enhancing a computer vision pipeline using YOLO-based detection and segmentation models plus a Hough line transform based post-processing step.

favorite.food: Dragon Chicken (It is a popular dish in the world of Indo-Chinese food (a fusion of Indian and Chinese cuisine). And for good reason - it's pretty epic! Crispy fried chicken strips, tossed in a spicy, sweet and sour sauce along with cashew nuts, capsicum, onion and chillies)
favorite.quote: I drink and I know things - Tyrion Lannister

projects.Predicting Vehicle Fuel Economy from Tec: • Built a multi-output CatBoost Regressor to estimate MPG/MPGe from pre-test vehicle specs (engine, drivetrain, body class, fuel-type), enabling early forecasting before costly and time-consuming city/highway certification testing. • Engineered 50+ model-ready features and benchmarked CatBoost against Random Forests and an ANN; CatBoost delivered the best generalization on unseen model years (test RMSE = 4.60, MAE = 1.40, R² = 0.94).
projects.A Federated Learning Approach for Speech: • Employed a wav2vec 2.0 frontend for feature extraction and a lightweight Multi-Scale Dilation Attention Network (MDAN) backend for multi-scale feature processing and classification. • Achieved 2.92% EER (equal error rate) and 0.2672 t-DCF (tandem detection cost function) on ASVspoof 2021 Logical Access and 2.99% EER on DeepFake partition, outperforming several centralized baselines.
projects.Photo to Monet Style Art (Style Transfer: • Developed an unpaired image-to-image translation model, aimed at learning a mapping of images from a source domain to a target domain without the need of paired images from the two domains to train on. • Used Cycle – Generative Adversarial Network (CycleGAN) architecture.

hobbies: Playing the piano, pickleball, anything outdoors
study_method: Night before the exam. Coffee + No Sleep.

links.about_me: I'm Ronak Vimal, a 22-year-old from Kerala, India currently based in College Park, Maryland, USA pursuing an MS in Applied Machine Learning at the University of Maryland. I love to connect with new people and keep growing. Professionally, I worked as a Machine Learning Intern at Big Vision LLC (Bengaluru), where I built practical AI solutions. My interests sit at the intersection of machine learning, computer vision, and MLOps, and I enjoy building systems that actually work end-to-end. Outside work, I'm into piano, pickleball, and basically anything outdoors. My idea of success is simple: being happy with myself.
